text: Of his 127,463 unique contributions in first 24 hours, @BetoORourke had 112,000 individual donors, per campaign. Puts average donation per person at about $55.
author: davidsiders

text: I can see I put this poorly. I regret that. What i meant to suggest is that if candidates were stylistically identical, would @BetoORourke stand out. I wish I’d said it better
author: davidsiders

text: He’s not outpolling her by releasing white papers
author: davidsiders

text: So many love @BetoORourke ‘s style. Trick w/ measuring it, though, is there’s no real control. Would be interesting to see how @SenWarren or @KamalaHarris did if they carved out a few days to stand on tables, go without notes, etc — or wait for the leveling stage of debates
author: davidsiders

text:
Q: where are you putting him?
A (from local organizer): ‘We have a table in the middle because, you know, he likes to stand on things.’ @BetoORourke #2020

text:
. @BetoORourke mused about buying his dad’s old truck back, but current owner hesitant: 
“Can you imagine Beto driving up to a rally in that little green truck and then it becomes a symbol and he wins the presidency? ... I’d have to shoot myself.”
author: davidsiders

text: . @BetoORourke declines to rule out big dollar fundraisers, but says he has no plans to hold any now
author: davidsiders

text: . @BetoORourke asked if he would commit to selecting a woman vice presidential candidate, declines to commit, says it would be presumptuous, but says ‘that would be my preference.’
author: davidsiders

text: . @BetoORourke shows up at a house party, where homeowner and Dubuque County recorder John Murphy, son of former lawmaker Pat Murphy, says he’s endorsing.
author: davidsiders

text: ‘We’re working on it’ - @BetoORourke , when asked if he has a campaign manager . And the he’s off

text: And just like that, the offending joke about marital roles is gone and replaced - ‘Amy and I are raising three amazing kids’
author: davidsiders

text: As for @BetoORourke ‘s other pace ...
author: davidsiders

text: ‘We’re setting the pace,’ @BetoORourke says, of his campaign’s own furious pace. Says he will show up, return, return again
author: davidsiders

text: . @BetoORourke is asked what he’s watching these days. ‘Schitt’s Creek,’ he says. I’m sure there will be no jokes
author: davidsiders

text: . @BetoORourke says he won't make the joke about his wife raising their kids 'sometimes with my help' anymore. He took criticism, said it's legitimate.
author: davidsiders

text: . @BetoORourke said he is 'mortified' to read the language he used as a teenager. "I have to take ownership of my words."
author: davidsiders

text: . @BetoORourke says he has heard ‘mixed reviews’ of @tacojohns . FWIW, I found one near his event the other day with a power outlet and ice in the soda machine, so no complaints
